borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p><span style="font-size:11pt">The outbuilding, by reason of siting, scale, mass and design, is an undesirable addition which is overly dominant in the rear garden setting, constitutes overdevelopment of the plot in combination with existing extensions and fails to appear subservient to the original dwelling. As such, it fails to respect or reflect the character of the original dwelling and wider local area, causing harm to each of these. The outbuilding thus fails to accord with the following policies which seek to ensure that development proposals are well designed and respect and reflect existing character:&nbsp;</span><br></p><p>Paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)</p><p>Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021)</p><p>Policies CP2 and CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)</p><p>Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</p><p>Sections 4.1 and 5.7 of the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</p><p>Policies SP2 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</p>

<p>The outbuilding, by reason of siting, mass, scale and orientation,&nbsp;causes&nbsp;unacceptable overshadowing to and an overbearing impact on the rear gardens of neighbouring dwellings. This causes harm to the amenity of neighbouring occupants, and as such constitutes un-neighbourly development.&nbsp;The outbuilding&nbsp;thus fails to accord with the following policies which seek to ensure development proposals protect residential amenity:</p><p>Paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)</p><p>Policy D6 of the London Plan (March 2021)</p><p>Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</p><p>Sections 4.2 and 5.7&nbsp;of the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</p><p>Policies DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</p>
description: Retrospective application for the construction of a single storey rear outbuilding
